meanings.definition: A member of an ancient people of central Italy.
meanings.sent1: The sabines were known for their strong sense of community.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied the culture of the sabines in ancient Italy.
meanings.sent3: The sabines decided to host a grand feast to celebrate their harvest.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the sabines symbolize resilience and unity.
meanings.sent5: The sabines' traditions were passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: A Roman matron who, with her husband, was converted to Christianity by St. Paul.
meanings.sent1: The sabines welcomed St. Paul with open arms when he visited Rome.
meanings.sent2: Many historians admire the courage of the sabines who embraced Christianity.
meanings.sent3: The sabines' conversion to Christianity brought joy to their community.
meanings.sent4: The story of the sabines' faith spread far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The sabines' devotion to their beliefs inspired others around them.
